Name: synthetic graphite production, battery grade | synthetic graphite, battery grade | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: The industrial product process starts with grinding and sizing the petroleum coke, which is then sent to the mixer where it is blended with the coal tar pitch.The mixture coming out of the mixer is cooled from 160-170 째C to around 100째C, and then fed into an extruder for subsequent forming in order to maximize the density of the mixture and shape it into the form and size of the final product. The formed product is heated to 800-1000 째C in a natural gas-fired furnace (carbonization process). In the graphitization furnace, which is exclusively powered by;electricity, the mixture is slowly fired to around 3000 째C for the formation of graphite crystals.;;Reference:;Dunn, J. B., James, C., Gaines, L., Gallagher, K., Dai, Q., & Kelly, J. C. (2015). Material and energy flows in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries (No. ANL/ESD-14/10 Rev). Argonne National Lab.(ANL), Argonne, IL (United States).
